00032 struct GraphicsData
00033 {
00034     SDL_Surface *screen;
00035     SDL_PixelFormat *fmt;
00036 
00037     int width;
00038     int height;
00039     int bpp;
00040     Uint32 flags;
00041 
00042     char *title;
00043     char *icon;
00044     int titleLength;
00045     int iconLength;
00046     
00047     //note that the camera data (origin, dest., angle, focus, etc...) should not
00048     // be here. that's part of the worldData. there should exist real TV
00049     // cameras in the track, and the virtual-driver's eyes are the in-car
00050     // camera.
00051     // Of course, we can add more cameras than TV+driver+spectators. We can make
00052     // use of some of the advantages of being a simulation in a computer :)
00053 };
00054 
00055 struct InputData
00056 {
00057     //here will go the definition of controllers, be it keyboard, mouse, wheel...
00058     // and probably some other things, such as number of controllers, number of
00059     // axis available, axis-calibration data...
00060 };
00061 
00062 struct PhysicsData
00063 {
00064     Uint32 timeStep;
00065     Uint32 desiredStepsPerSecond;
00066     // this struct is used by the physics engine. it will store things like
00067     // timestep to use... .... mmm well, i can't think of other example of
00068     // system data for the physicsEngine, but i suppose you get the idea.
00069 };
00070 
00071 struct GuiData
00072 {
00073     int nextMenuIndex; //main menu = 1;  options menu = 2;
00074     int lastMenuIndex;
00075 };

00077 class SystemData
00078 { //this contains all the data not related with the simulated/virtual world
00079 
00080     bool mainLoopEnabled;
00081     bool simLoopEnabled;
00082     bool guiLoopEnabled;
00083     public:
00084         //independent data
00085         struct GraphicsData graphicsData;
00086         struct InputData inputData;
00087         struct PhysicsData physicsData;
00088         struct GuiData guiData;
00089 
00090         //main loop time control data
00091         Uint32 currentSimLoopTime;
00092         Uint32 currentPhysicsTime;
00093         Uint32 lastStatTime;
00094         int physicsSteps;
00095         Uint32 physicsStepsPerSecond;
00096         int graphicsSteps;
00097         Uint32 graphicsStepsPerSecond;
00098 
00099 
00100         bool canMainLoopRun(void);  //does the program have to keep running?
00101         bool canSimLoopRun(void);   //does the simulation have to keep running?
00102         bool canGuiLoopRun(void);   //does the gui have to keep running?
00103 
00104         void enableMainLoop (void); //allows the program to start running
00105         void enableSimLoop (void);  //allows the simulation to start running
00106         void enableGuiLoop (void);  //allows the gui to start running
00107 
00108         void disableMainLoop (void);//allows the program to stop running
00109         void disableSimLoop (void); //allows the simulation to stop running
00110         void disableGuiLoop (void); //allows the gui to stop running
00111 
00112 };
